SEARCH
Package chess.logic.board

Class Board

java.lang.Object
chess.logic.board.Board
public class Board extends Object
Represents a Board in a chess game. This class manages the game board, including pieces, player turns, and legal moves.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    Board.Builder
    Represents a builder for creating a Board object with a custom configuration of pieces.

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the chess board. Each square on the board is represented by its respective piece or an empty square. The representation is formatted to display the board in a human-readable format with 8 rows and 8 columns.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of the chess board

      public Square getSquare(int squareCoord)

      Parameters:
      squareCoord - the coordinate of the square
      Returns:
      the square at the specified coordinate

    • initStdBoard

      public static Board initStdBoard()
      Initializes a standard chess board with the default starting position of pieces for both players. This method constructs a new builder, adds pieces for both white and black players to the initial board configuration, and sets the move maker to white. It then builds a new board using the builder and returns it.
      Returns:
      a new Board object representing the standard chess board with the default starting position of pieces

    • getAllLegalMoves

      public Iterable<Move> getAllLegalMoves()
      Retrieves all legal moves available on the current board for both white and black players. This method retrieves the legal moves for the white player and the black player, combines them into a single list, and returns an iterable collection of all legal moves.
      Returns:
      an iterable collection of all legal moves available on the current board
